definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]

sentences.english: Sun, the Lehman Brothers economist, says as manufacturers are pushed to the brink, China's stock markets could see sharp declines.
sentences.chinese: 孙明春表示，制造商被推倒悬崖边缘，中国股市大跌。

sentences.english: Obama's foreign policy is no less strange.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马的外交政策也令人大跌眼镜。

sentences.english: What most of us care about is being surprised.
sentences.chinese: 我们大多数人在意的是大跌眼镜。

sentences.english: The sharp drop in oil prices starting in mid-2014 is changing this picture.
sentences.chinese: 自2014年中期以来的油价大跌正在改变这种局面。

sentences.english: But as the pound drops, the currency markets appear to have run out of patience.
sentences.chinese: 可当英镑大跌时，货币市场似乎已经失去了耐心。

sentences.english: MARKETS in Asia and Europe plummeted on Friday October 10th.
sentences.chinese: 亚洲和欧洲金融市场在10月10日的周五大跌。

sentences.english: Watching this horror movie on TV has made me lose my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 看了这部恐怖片，让我大跌胃口，完全吃不下去饭。

sentences.english: Even copper, which had a major rout on Friday, is managing to get in on the action.
sentences.chinese: 甚至连上周五大跌的铜，也抓住了这波势头。

sentences.english: Gold has usually jumped when stocks have swooned.
sentences.chinese: 金价通常会在股市大跌时飙升。

definition: (of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
to fall back (of water level or share prices)
devastating setback/slump (in stock market etc)/crushing defeat/to cause a serious setback/to plummet
to bounce/to bounce back/to boomerang/to ricochet/rebound (of stock market etc)/bounce/backlash/negative repercussions
(of a market index etc) to fall below (a given level)/to be injured or damaged as a result of a fall
to fall back/to return to low level after a rise (in water level, price etc)
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
to regurgitate/(fig.) (of a stock market) to give up (gains)
